intro: Encholirium gracile, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually pink to red in color, attracting various pollinators. Encholirium gracile is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
